[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 80]
Reasoning: **The Calculation**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm in Ante 4, Round 9 against "Boss (The Pillar)", and I need 10,000 chips to advance. Currently, I've got 7,222, so I need to make another 2,778 with only three hands remaining and one discard. My money's at $6, so I really need to make this count.

I've got a decent hand: 10 of Spades, 7 of Spades, 6 of Spades, 4 of Spades, and an Ace of Hearts (which is a Wild Card!). I've also got a Queen of Clubs, and it's a bonus card that will give me +30 chips.

I have some powerful Jokers in play: "Odd Todd" (adds chips for odd cards), "Abstract Joker" (a flat multiplier), "The Tribe" (a 2x multiplier if I hit a Flush), "Gift Card" (adds a Joker slot), and "Acrobat" (a 3x multiplier on the *final* hand of the round).

My immediate thought is, with those Spades and the Wild Ace, I can make a Flush, right? Flush Level 3, to be exact. Let's see... base chips 65, base multiplier of 8. I have two odd cards: the 7 and the Ace. I can use the Ace as a Spade. Odd Todd will give me a boost of 31 chips for each of those two odd cards, for a total of 62 chips. So, the total chips I can get from this flush are 65 (base) + 10 (10S) + 7 (7S) + 6 (6S) + 4 (4S) + 11 (A-Spades) + 62 (Todd) which comes out to 165.

The base multiplier is 8, but I have the "Abstract Joker" which adds 15 to it. Also, "The Tribe" doubles the multiplier if I have a Flush. So, the total multiplier is (8 + 15) * 2 = 46.

Therefore, the total hand score will be 165 (chips) * 46 (mult) = 7,590.

Since I only need 2,778 chips, I'll clear the round with no problem (7,222 + 7,590 = 14,812). I don't need to consider any other cards or discards to win. I should just play the hand I have! Let's do it.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
